newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico peso closes steady after quiet session.
newsitem.headline: Mexico peso closes steady after quiet session.

text.p: The Mexican peso reversed earlier weakness to close stable on Tuesday after what traders said was a quiet session.
Traders felt that some banks exercised dollar puts they had bought from the central bank.
"They probably exercised a good part of their puts," said a trader.
The benchmark 48-hour peso closed 0.4 of a centavo firmer at 7.8880/7.8940 per dollar, while its 24-hour counterpart closed unchanged at 7.8830/7.8880.
The same-day peso closed earlier one centavo firmer at 7.8840/7.8850 per dollar.
Traders said the session was very quiet due to a public holiday on Wednesday.
Mexican financial markets will be closed on Wednesday due to the national holiday for the Anniversary of the Revolution.
Traders said they felt trade could still be slow on Thursday when the markets open again, but could pick up on traditional month-end dollar demand next week.
